intro: Heliocarpus horridus, commonly known as the rough sycamore, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
